ai-dhp:360.4_0: good is restraint of the tongue.
ai-dhp:361.1_0: Restraint of the body is good;
ai-dhp:362.1_0: One restrained in hand and foot,
ai-dhp:362.2_0: and in speech, the supreme restraint;
ai-dhp:362.4_0: that is what they call a mendicant.
ai-dhp:363.1_0: When a mendicant of restrained mouth,
ai-dhp:363.3_0: He proclaims what is the Teaching as the Teaching,
ai-dhp:364.2_0: though I keenly contemplated the teaching,
ai-dhp:364.4_0: doesn’t decline in the true teaching.”
ai-dhp:365.1_0: A well-off mendicant ought not look down
ai-dhp:365.2_0: on others, nor should they be envious.
ai-dhp:366.1_0: If a mendicant is poor in offerings,
ai-dhp:366.2_0: the well-to-do ought not look down on them.
ai-dhp:366.3_0: For the gods indeed praise them,
ai-dhp:366.4_0: who are tireless and pure of livelihood.
ai-dhp:367.1_0: One who has no sense of ownership
ai-dhp:367.2_0: in the whole realm of name and form,
ai-dhp:367.3_0: who does not grieve for that which is lost,
ai-dhp:367.4_0: who is said to be a mendicant.
ai-dhp:368.1_0: A mendicant who meditates on love,
ai-dhp:368.3_0: I realized the state of peace;
ai-dhp:369.2_0: When bailed out it will float lightly.
ai-dhp:369.3_0: Having cut off desire and hate,
ai-dhp:370.1_0: Five to cut, five to drop,
ai-dhp:370.3_0: A mendicant must escape five chains
ai-dhp:370.4_0: is said to have crossed the flood.
ai-dhp:371.2_0: Don’t let the mind delight in the senses!
ai-dhp:371.3_0: Don’t heedlessly swallow a hot iron ball!
ai-dhp:371.4_0: And when it burns, don’t cry, “Oh, the pain!”
ai-dhp:372.1_0: No absorption for one without wisdom,
ai-dhp:372.2_0: no wisdom for one without absorption.
ai-dhp:372.3_0: But one with absorption and wisdom
ai-dhp:372.4_0: is in the presence of quenching.
ai-dhp:373.1_0: A mendicant who enters an empty hut
ai-dhp:373.2_0: who has cut off craving for continued existence,
ai-dhp:373.4_0: as they rightly discern the Dhamma.
ai-dhp:374.2_0: of the rise and fall of the aggregates,
ai-dhp:374.4_0: that is the deathless for one who knows.

ai-dhp:381.3_0: I realized the state of peace;

ai-dhp:388.0_0: The brahmin lady who had gone forth when old
ai-dhp:388.1_0: A brahmin’s so-called because they bar out evil,
ai-dhp:388.2_0: an ascetic’s so-called since they live a serene life.
ai-dhp:388.3_0: One who has renounced all stains
ai-dhp:389.1_0: One should never strike a brahmin,
ai-dhp:389.2_0: as a brahmin, not a brahmin.
ai-dhp:389.3_0: Woe to the one who hurts a brahmin,
ai-dhp:389.4_0: and woe for the one who retaliates.
ai-dhp:390.1_0: Nothing is better for a brahmin
ai-dhp:390.2_0: than to hold their mind back from attachment.
ai-dhp:390.3_0: As cruelty in the mind gradually subsides,
ai-dhp:391.2_0: There is no act of wrong conduct.
ai-dhp:391.4_0: I declare them to a brahmin.
ai-dhp:392.2_0: the one from whom you learn the Dhamma

ai-dhp:393.1_0: Not by matted hair or family,
ai-dhp:393.2_0: or birth is one a brahmin.

ai-dhp:393.4_0: they are pure, they are brahmins.

ai-dhp:423.8_0: That’s how to define a mendicant who has eight things robbed and finished one, the twelfth in the whole world, the flower, and the temporary regulations. There are twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, or fifty.
